member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLiteDataSource.Cache
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache to be used by this data source. The default is .NET's System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLiteDataSource.DatabaseMetadata
member.summary: This object can be used to lookup database information.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLiteDataSource.EnforceForeignKeys
member.summary: If set, foreign keys will be enabled/disabled as per 'PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON|OFF'. When null, SQLite's default is used.
member.remarks: Currently the SQLite default is off, but this may change in a future version. The SQLite documentation recommends always explicitly setting this value.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLiteDataSource.ConnectionString
member.summary: This object can be used to access the database connection string.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLiteDataSource.ExtensionCache
member.summary: The extension cache is used by extensions to store data source specific information.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLiteDataSource.BeginTransaction(System.Nullable{System.Data.IsolationLevel},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new transaction.
member.remarks: The caller of this method is responsible for closing the transaction.

member.summary: Creates a new transaction.
member.remarks: The caller of this method is responsible for closing the transaction.

member.remarks: The caller of this method is responsible for closing the connection.

member.name: T:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.LockType
member.summary: This is used for ensuring that only one writer is active at a time for a given SQLite database.

member.name: F:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.LockType.None
member.summary: No lock will be obtained by Chain.

member.name: F:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.LockType.Read
member.summary: The operation only performs reads.

member.name: F:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.LockType.Write
member.summary: The operation potentially performs writes.
member.remarks: When in doubt, use this mode.

member.name: T:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteDataSourceSettings
member.summary: This class is used to modify settings that are not represented by the connection string.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteDataSourceSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteDataSourceSettings.DisableLocks
member.summary: Normally we use a reader/writer lock to avoid simultaneous writes to a SQlite database. If you disable this locking, you may see extra noise in your tracing output or unexpected exceptions.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteDataSourceSettings.EnforceForeignKeys
member.summary: If set, foreign keys will be enabled/disabled as per 'PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON|OFF'. When null, SQLite's default is used.
member.remarks: Currently the SQLite default is off, but this may change in a future version. The SQLite documentation recommends always explicitly setting this value.

member.name: T:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache
member.summary: Handles caching of metadata for various SQLite tables and views.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.#ctor(System.Data.SQLite.SQLiteConnectionStringBuilder)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.GetIndexesForTable(Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteObjectName)
member.summary: Gets the indexes for a table.
member.exception: Indexes are not supported by this data source
member.remarks: This should be cached on a TableOrViewMetadata object.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.GetTableOrView(Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteObjectName)
member.summary: Gets the metadata for a table or view.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.GetTableOrViewFromClass``1
member.summary: Returns the table or view derived from the class's name and/or Table attribute.
member.typeparam: The type of the object.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.GetTablesAndViews
member.summary: Gets the tables and views that were loaded by this cache.
member.remarks: Call Preload before invoking this method to ensure that all tables and views were loaded from the database's schema. Otherwise only the objects that were actually used thus far will be returned.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.Preload
member.summary: Preloads all of the metadata for this data source.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.PreloadTables
member.summary: Preloads metadata for all database tables.
member.remarks: This is normally used only for testing. By default, metadata is loaded as needed.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.PreloadViews
member.summary: Preloads metadata for all database views.
member.remarks: This is normally used only for testing. By default, metadata is loaded as needed.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.Reset
member.summary: Resets the metadata cache, clearing out all cached metadata.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.ParseObjectName(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the name of the database object.

member.name: M:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.SqlTypeNameToDbType(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Determines the database column type from the column type name.
member.param: Name of the database column type.
member.remarks: This does not honor registered types. This is only used for the database's hard-coded list of native types.

member.name: P:Tortuga.Chain.SQLite.SQLiteMetadataCache.MaxParameters
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of parameters in a single SQL batch.
member.remarks: https://sqlite.org/limits.html
